meanings.definition: The act of applying a substance to reduce friction between surfaces.
meanings.sent1: Proper lubrication of the gears ensures they move smoothly without causing damage.
meanings.sent2: Regular lubrication of the bike chain helps it last longer and perform better.
meanings.sent3: The robot demanded extra lubrication for its squeaky joints, or it threatened to go on strike.
meanings.sent4: In the world of relationships, trust acts as the lubrication that keeps everything running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The car engine roared to life thanks to the perfect lubrication of its parts.

meanings.definition: The process of making something slippery or smooth.
meanings.sent1: The lubrication of the slide made it extra fun for the kids at the playground.
meanings.sent2: The lubrication of the door hinges made them silent as a whisper.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret to a perfect omelette was the right amount of butter for lubrication.
meanings.sent4: Laughter acted as the social lubrication that eased the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The skater glided effortlessly on the ice rink, thanks to the perfect lubrication of her skates.

meanings.sent1: The smooth lubrication of the engine indicated it was well-maintained.
meanings.sent2: The proper lubrication of the joints allowed for easy movement.
meanings.sent3: The excessive lubrication of the pan caused the eggs to slide right off.
meanings.sent4: His charm served as the social lubrication that helped him make friends easily.
meanings.sent5: The bicycle chain's lack of lubrication led to a squeaky and inefficient ride.
